custom_fields.key_topics: This course covers insulin signaling in mammalian cells
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Assessments include: quizzes, individual presentation & a final comprehensive exam
custom_fields.goals: By taking this course, students will1Demonstrate a sound understanding of the design and rational behind western blot technique, identify the different steps of the experimental protocol, distinguish between the type of controls and understand their relevance2Apply western blot technique to study insulin signaling in mammalian cells, generate and analyze scientific data3Prepare, present and discuss a summary of their experimentation and conclusions with their peers
custom_fields.relevance: A unique hands-on experience in a biology lab to carry out experiments, collect and analyses data to infer biological principals

long_desc: The course provides a handson experience in biology lab to conduct experiments, collect and analyze scientific data with the purpose of using the data to infer biological principals. Students will learn the details of western blot technique, commonly used in biology labs. In addition, they will apply the technique to study how insulin triggers specific signaling in target cells. This lab module will reinforce the students understanding of material seen in Cell Biology lecture course corequisite 03240 and will prepare them for future lab courses.
name: Applied Cell Biology
